column2: Kara, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Recommended  by optometrist.  Used before bedtime for only 2 nights.  Reaction of slightly swollen eyes and face in morning, which went away after on my feet for awhile. Have some facial skin itching two days later. Could have been worse if I wasn't on a daily antihistamine.

column2: refresh, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: For some reason crystals form on my eyelids by a.m. I have been instructed to use the drops 6 to 8 times per day.

The first time I used it before bed(and each time thereafter, with varying degrees) I awoke with my eyes seemingly stuck shut! This morning they were "stuck" for a minute and a half before I could open them. Scary! This was my final time using them!

column2: Donna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Had an reaction to it.  Now got scarred eyelids where I did not know it was what was causing the rawness of my eyes and the redness to be so much worst.  Eye dr. recommended it. My eyes got so raw that I could not touch them.  I was lucky enough to not have it on me and to by another type and that is when it dawn on me that you can have a reaction to a med that suppose to not be that reactive.

column1: Drying and Inflammation of Cornea and Conjunctiva of Eyes
column2: SmileyWitchFaerie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ever since I went to the optometrist and was prescribed Genteal which has this drug in it, my vision has been great . I also found out that my insomnia was caused by severe dry eyes , it was really bad. I had lesions behind my eyes and the pain was unbearable. It was as if there were lots of hammer drills , drilling behind my eye balls working over time. the migraines were making it worst. I actually sleep now for more than 2 hours at at time and no longer have migraines since I started using this in Oct. 2009. being an insomniac for many years sleep sounds like heaven!

column2: B mcvey, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I must be allergic.  My eyes we killing me until I stopped the drops.  They were red and burning and swollen.

column2: carole, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After starting eye drops 3 weeks ago, I am amazed at the reduced uncomfortable feeling in my eyes. I use the drops morning and evening. I still am challenged getting the drops in the eye properly, but it is getting easier.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was told by my eye Dr. to use this, and awoke the next morning to  my eyes swollen shut, and my face was swollen. So obviously I am allergic to it.

column1: Drying and Inflammation of Cornea and Conjunctiva of Eyes
column2: KittyLover, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This was prescribed for my 5-month old foster kitten who has a/genesis, scarring of the cornea and infection (along with 5 other meds.  This being the last one I use seems to really comfort the kitty's eyes (her name is "Squint"), loosening the hair that is rubbing into her cornea.  Speaking for Squint, I believe she's very happy with it!  :o)
